page.title: 09CARE OF MENTALLY HANDICAPPED
page.content: Both the Jarman Centre amd Bennetts End Hospital are for the Mentally Handicapped. Bennetts End Hospital has people living there and the Jarman Centre is a Day Centre. The Day Centre is funded by the Social Services and the Hospital by the Regional Health Authority. In Bennetts End Hospital the adults and children live like part of a family. Adult wards can take about 25 people and the children's wards have about 8 beds. The hospital is linked with the Centre and adults sometimes spend the day there. People go to Jarman's Centre from 10am. to 3pm. and have different classes. The hospital has 5 wards and one is being made into a hostel. The bathrooms are specially equipped. Jarman's Centre has a building donated by the firm,Marks and Spencer.
